parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To go up, mount, ascend; of things: I rise, spring up, come up. From ana and the base of basis; to go up.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To condemn, judge worthy of punishment. From kata and krino; to judge against, i.e. Sentence.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
